definition: successfully accomplished (project or goal)/to be highly successful
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Attach it to a shoelace or a string, and you've got yourself a fishing line.
sentences.chinese: 把它系在鞋帶或細線上，釣魚線就大功告成了。

sentences.english: Simply drag a line, write some text and you’re done.
sentences.chinese: 簡單的畫一條線，添加一些文本，大功告成。

sentences.english: Combine basil with feta and tomato and you've got a winning combination.
sentences.chinese: 把羅勒和乳酪，小西紅柿混合在一起，就大功告成了。

sentences.english: The cooking time is only 5 minutes in a 232-degree oven.
sentences.chinese: 在攝氏232度的烤箱內只需5分鐘便可大功告成了。

sentences.english: When the cloud evaporates, the ice cream is ready.
sentences.chinese: 當霧開雲散，冰淇淋就大功告成了。

sentences.english: She exulted to find that she had succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 她爲自己大功告成而狂喜。

sentences.english: You can’t expect things to happen immediately.
sentences.chinese: 你不能奢求事情一下大功告成。

sentences.english: Mix in pasta. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese or crumbled feta on top before serving.
sentences.chinese: 完成後再灑上意大利乾酪粉或羊乳酪屑就大功告成了。

definition: everything in its place and ready (idiom)
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
procedure/step
to fix/to settle/to wangle
lit. everything is ready, all we need is an east wind (idiom)/fig. lacking only one tiny crucial item
pinyin: wan4 shi4 ju4 bei4 , zhi3 qian4 dong1 feng1

definition: to put to good use/to come in handy
everything is fine (idiom); all is well with the world
to load
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
victory is in sight
to stop work for the day (generally of laborers)/to knock off
finished goods/a finished product
to be ready
couldn't be better/ideal/wonderful
to blend (cooking)/to mix evenly
